result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond Michael Truxal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine $505.00   Pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.
DNA Surcharge $200.00   Pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

judgments.dispoDesc: Fine/Costs $705.00 given 30 DTP or set up a payment plan.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raymond Michael Truxal in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised DE as to his right to have an Atty.  DE waived his right to an Atty.  Court finds DE has freely waived his right to an Attorney.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  DE entered plea of guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.  

Court:  Fine/Costs $705.00 given 30 DTP or set up a payment plan.

Defendant Raymond Michael Truxal in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.  DE will temporarily waive his right to counsel to speak to the DA first.  Court finds defendant is freely temporarily waiving right to an attorney Court bail will continue.
No contact with Sheriff Mark Kelsey, residence and family.
No contact with Sheriff Mark Kelsey, residence and family.
Defendant appeared in custody via video.  Atty Marcoux appeared for the State.  S/B set $2500.00 No contact with Sheriff Mark Kelsey, residence and family.
